trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support for WebPartZoneBaseDesigner controls.

WebPartZoneBaseDesigner is the base class for <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneDesigner> and can be inherited to support custom implementations of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> controls.

WebPartZoneBaseDesigner extends its own base class, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebZoneDesigner>, by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle%2A> property.

Otherwise, the main purpose of this class for a control developer is that, unlike its parent, WebPartZoneBaseDesigner has a public constructor so it can be inherited directly and used as a public implementation of the base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBaseDesigner"></xref> class.
Initializes an instance of the designer bound to the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase"></xref> control associated with this designer.
Hides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle*> property at design time.

The PreFilterProperties method overrides <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle%2A> property in the designer after calling the parent method.
This is because the default <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> control does not render any zone-level verbs.
If you wish to render zone-level verbs in a derived class, you must override this method to not hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.VerbStyle%2A> property.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the set of properties associated with the control.
